intro: Cryptocarya tuanku-bujangii, commonly known as the Tuanku Bujang cryptocarya, is a rare and endemic species native to Malaysia. It belongs to the Lauraceae family, which includes laurels and avocado trees, and is characterized by its aromatic foliage. The plant typically grows in lowland rainforests, where it thrives in humid and shaded environments. Its leaves are dark green and革质 (leathery), with a distinctive aromatic scent when crushed. Due to its limited distribution and habitat specificity, it is considered a vulnerable species facing threats from deforestation and habitat loss.
